required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tiotropium / Respimat One Year Study in COPD.
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy {FEV1, COPD Exacerbations & HRQoL} & Safety of 5mcg Tiotropium Respimat in COPD

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to evaluate the long-term (one year) efficacy and safety of tiotropium delivered by the Respimat inhaler in patients with COPD. Specifically, the study will examine the effect of treatment on COPD exacerbations.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) at Day 337
primary_outcome.description: Trough FEV1 is defined as the FEV1 measured at the -10 min time point at the end of the dosing interval (24 h post drug administration).

primary_outcome.measure: Time to First Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Exacerbation
primary_outcome.time_frame: During actual study treatment period (planned Day 1 to Day 337)
primary_outcome.description: Time to first COPD exacerbation (defined as a complex of respiratory events/symptoms (increase or new onset) with a duration of 3 days or more requiring a change in treatment). Time is days from start of study treatment to onset of exacerbation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) at Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Trough FEV1 is the mean volume of air that can be forced out in one second after taking a deep breath approximately 24 hours after the last administration of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) at Day 169
secondary_outcome.description: Trough FEV1 is the mean volume of air that can be forced out in one second after taking a deep breath approximately 24 hours after the last administration of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of COPD Exacerbations Per Patient - Exposure Adjusted
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During actual study treatment period (planned Day 1 to Day 337)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of COPD exacerbations (defined as a complex of respiratory events/symptoms (increase or new onset) with a duration of 3 days or more requiring a change in treatment) per patient adjusted by length of treatment exposure (i.e. number of exacerbations multiplied by 365.25 and then divided by days of treatment exposure)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of COPD Exacerbations Per Patient - naïve Estimate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During actual study treatment period (planned Day 1 to Day 337)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of COPD exacerbations (defined as a complex of respiratory events/symptoms (increase or new onset) with a duration of 3 days or more requiring a change in treatment) per patient not adjusted for treatment exposure (i.e. naïve estimate)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With at Least One COPD Exacerbation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During actual study treatment period (planned Day 1 to Day 337)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with at least one COPD exacerbation (defined as a complex of respiratory events/symptoms (increase or new onset) with a duration of 3 days or more requiring a change in treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Hospitalisation for COPD Exacerbation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During actual study treatment period (planned Day 1 to Day 337)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first hospitalisation for COPD exacerbation (a complex of respiratory events/symptoms (increase or new onset) with a duration of 3 days or more requiring a change in treatment). Time is days from start of study treatment to onset of exacerbation

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Hospitalisations for COPD Exacerbations Per Patient - Exposure Adjusted
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During actual study treatment period (planned Day 1 to Day 337)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of hospitalisations for COPD exacerbations (a complex of respiratory events/symptoms (increase or new onset) with a duration of 3 days or more requiring a change in treatment) per patient adjusted by length of treatment exposure (i.e. no. of exacerbations multiplied by 365.25 and then divided by days of treatment exposure)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Hospitalisations for COPD Exacerbations Per Patient - naïve Estimate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During actual study treatment period (planned Day 1 to Day 337)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of hospitalisations for COPD exacerbations (a complex of respiratory events/symptoms (increase or new onset) with a duration of 3 days or more requiring a change in treatment) per patient not adjusted for treatment exposure (i.e. naïve estimate)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With at Least One Hospitalisation for a COPD Exacerbation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During actual study treatment period (planned Day 1 to Day 337)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with at least one hospitalisation for a COPD exacerbation (a complex of respiratory events/symptoms (increase or new onset) with a duration of 3 days or more requiring a change in treatment)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Total Score at Day 337
secondary_outcome.description: The SGRQ total score measures quality of life on a continuous scale ranging from 0=best state to 100=worst state

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Total Score at Day 169
secondary_outcome.description: The SGRQ total score measures quality of life on a continuous scale ranging from 0=best state to 100=worst state

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Domain Score at Day 337
secondary_outcome.description: The SGRQ domain score (symptom, activity and impact) measures quality of life on a continuous scale ranging from 0=best state to 100=worst state

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Saint George's Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) Domain Score at Day 169
secondary_outcome.description: The SGRQ domain score (symptom, activity and impact) measures quality of life on a continuous scale ranging from 0=best state to 100=worst state

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) at Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: Trough FVC is the mean maximum volume of air that can be forcibly expired from the lungs; measured approximately 24 hours after the last administration of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) at Day 169
secondary_outcome.description: Trough FVC is the mean maximum volume of air that can be forcibly expired from the lungs; measured approximately 24 hours after the last administration of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) at Day 337
secondary_outcome.description: Trough FVC is the mean maximum volume of air that can be forcibly expired from the lungs; measured approximately 24 hours after the last administration of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Marked Changes From Baseline in Vital Signs at End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Marked changes from baseline in vital signs (diastolic and systolic blood pressure (DBP and SBP) and pulse rate (PR)) at end of treatment. SBP - Increase means SBP >150 mmHg and an increase above baseline of >25 mmHg. SBP - Decrease means SBP <100 mmHg and a decrease below baseline of >10 mmHg. DBP - Increase means DBP >90 mmHg and an increase above baseline of >10 mmHg. DBP - Decrease means DBP <60 mmHg and a decrease below baseline of >10 mmHg. PR - Increase means PR >100 bpm and an increase above baseline of >10 bpm. PR - Decrease means PR <60 bpm and a decrease below baseline of >10 bpm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically Relevant Findings in Physical Examination and ECG
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically relevant findings in Physical Examination and ECG at end of treatment

arm_group.description: Tiotropium 5µg via Respimat® inhaler (2 inhalations of 2.5µg per day) + usual maintenance treatment (only anticholinergic bronchodilators were excluded)
Placebo via Respimat® inhaler (2 inhalations per day) + usual maintenance treatment (only anticholinergic bronchodilators were excluded)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female
2. At least 40 years old
3. Smoker or ex-smoker
4. Smoking history > 10 pack-years
5. Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) < 60% predicted
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Recent history of myocardial infarction, life-threatening cardiac arrhythmia or hospitalisation for cardiac failure
2. History of asthma or allergic conditions.
3. Malignancy requiring treatment within past 5 years
4. Life-threatening pulmonary obstruction, cystic fibrosis or clinically evident bronchiectasis
5. Known active tuberculosis
6. Known hypersensitivity to anticholinergic drugs.

measure.description: The TS was made up of all randomised and treated participants excluding 74 patients with potential fraudulent data from one investigator site

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) at Day 337
outcome.description: Trough FEV1 is defined as the FEV1 measured at the -10 min time point at the end of the dosing interval (24 h post drug administration).
outcome.population: The FAS was made up of all randomised and treated participants excluding 99 patients with questionable data. 133 participants from the FAS were excluded due to insufficient FEV1 data.

group.title: Tiotropium
group.description: Tiotropium 5µg via Respimat® inhaler (2 inhalations of 2.5µg per day) + usual maintenance treatment (only anticholinergic bronchodilators were excluded)

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo via Respimat® inhaler (2 inhalations per day) + usual maintenance treatment (only anticholinergic bronchodilators were excluded)

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) at Day 337
measure.description: Trough FEV1 is defined as the FEV1 measured at the -10 min time point at the end of the dosing interval (24 h post drug administration).
measure.population: The FAS was made up of all randomised and treated participants excluding 99 patients with questionable data. 133 participants from the FAS were excluded due to insufficient FEV1 data.

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA with pooled centre, LABA use, and treatment fitted as main effects and the baseline trough FEV1 as a covariate.

outcome.title: Time to First Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Exacerbation
outcome.description: Time to first COPD exacerbation (defined as a complex of respiratory events/symptoms (increase or new onset) with a duration of 3 days or more requiring a change in treatment). Time is days from start of study treatment to onset of exacerbation.
outcome.time_frame: During actual study treatment period (planned Day 1 to Day 337)
outcome.population: The FAS was made up of all randomised and treated participants excluding 99 patients with questionable data.

group.title: Tiotropium
group.description: Tiotropium 5µg via Respimat® inhaler (2 inhalations of 2.5µg per day) + usual maintenance treatment (only anticholinergic bronchodilators were excluded)

measure.title: Time to First Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Exacerbation
measure.description: Time to first COPD exacerbation (defined as a complex of respiratory events/symptoms (increase or new onset) with a duration of 3 days or more requiring a change in treatment). Time is days from start of study treatment to onset of exacerbation.
measure.population: The FAS was made up of all randomised and treated participants excluding 99 patients with questionable data.

measurement_list.measurement: As <50% of the patients experienced an exacerbation in both treatment groups the median and 95% confidence interval were not estimable. Refer to the secondary endpoint 'Number of patients with at least one COPD exacerbation' for further information.

As <50% of the patients experienced an exacerbation in both treatment groups the median and 95% confidence interval were not estimable. Refer to the secondary endpoint 'Number of patients with at least one COPD exacerbation' for further information.

outcome.population: The FAS was made up of all randomised and treated participants excluding 99 patients with questionable data. 147 participants from the FAS were excluded due to insufficient FEV1 data.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Trough Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) at Day 29
outcome.description: Trough FVC is the mean maximum volume of air that can be forcibly expired from the lungs; measured approximately 24 hours after the last administration of study drug.
outcome.population: The FAS was made up of all randomised and treated participants excluding 99 patients with questionable data. 147 participants from the FAS were excluded due to insufficient FVC data.

outcome.title: Marked Changes From Baseline in Vital Signs at End of Treatment
outcome.description: Marked changes from baseline in vital signs (diastolic and systolic blood pressure (DBP and SBP) and pulse rate (PR)) at end of treatment. SBP - Increase means SBP >150 mmHg and an increase above baseline of >25 mmHg. SBP - Decrease means SBP <100 mmHg and a decrease below baseline of >10 mmHg. DBP - Increase means DBP >90 mmHg and an increase above baseline of >10 mmHg. DBP - Decrease means DBP <60 mmHg and a decrease below baseline of >10 mmHg. PR - Increase means PR >100 bpm and an increase above baseline of >10 bpm. PR - Decrease means PR <60 bpm and a decrease below baseline of >10 bpm.
outcome.population: Treated set

group.title: Tiotropium
group.description: Tiotropium 5µg via Respimat® inhaler (2 inhalations of 2.5µg per day) + usual maintenance treatment (only anticholinergic bronchodilators were excluded)

DBP - Increase means DBP >90 mmHg and an increase above baseline of >10 mmHg. DBP - Decrease means DBP <60 mmHg and a decrease below baseline of >10 mmHg. PR - Increase means PR >100 bpm and an increase above baseline of >10 bpm. PR - Decrease means PR <60 bpm and a decrease below baseline of >10 bpm.
